{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3344112,"name":"Doruk Yıldırım","username":"Albiorin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/albiorin/{size}/213194_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:23:38.953Z","cooked":"

Hi all. we are planning to switch to a dynamic shooter for our champs bot. The design and fabrication is already underway but I am just curious as to how other teams have approached the problem of finding the correct angle of the shooter based on the distance. What are the strategies you guys implemented?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:23:38.953Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":783,"readers_count":782,"score":356.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Doruk Yıldırım","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/limelight-used-to-adjust-shooting-angle/460422/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Limelight used to adjust shooting angle","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55327,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8780 Programming Lead / Driver"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/1","custom_user_title":"8780 Programming Lead / Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3344135,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:33:42.042Z","cooked":"

image458×645 16.7 KB

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:33:42.042Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":768,"readers_count":767,"score":253.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/3/930358fd8eb04395f1a6ffffcb23547cf7280a3b.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/2","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344147,"name":"Dan_Karol","username":"Dan_Karol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan_karol/{size}/227378_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:41:06.682Z","cooked":"

We use this:

en.wikipedia.org

Projectile motion | Angle θ required to hit coordinate (x, y)

To hit a target at range x and altitude y when fired from (0,0) and with initial speed v the required angle(s) of launch θ are:

2 things to know:
Your launcher wont be perfectly efficient so you may want to include a scaling factor between your launcher motor speed and your note exit velocity.

the quadratic includes +/-. The - direction will be the flatter launch angle so you probably don’t need to solve the + condition.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:41:06.682Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":726,"readers_count":725,"score":230.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Dan_Karol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Projectile_motion#Angle_%CE%B8_required_to_hit_coordinate_(x,_y)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Projectile motion - Wikipedia","clicks":82}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7133,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"131 CHAOS"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/3","custom_user_title":"131 CHAOS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344150,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:43:40.875Z","cooked":"

Post 2 shows: angle = f(distance) with f being the tangent.
You can add flywheel speed to that, if you want, for two independent variables.
You might find a speed that gives a fairly flat shot and the angle isn’t as strong of a relationship as tangent.
We ignore the theoretical and experiment a lot to make a table look up map.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:43:40.875Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":694,"readers_count":693,"score":138.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344151,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:43:57.029Z","cooked":"

Do you launch the same speed for all distances?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:43:57.029Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":657,"readers_count":656,"score":136.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7133,"username":"Dan_Karol","name":"Dan_Karol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan_karol/{size}/227378_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/5","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344152,"name":"Steven Pearson","username":"spearson23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/779978/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:44:06.257Z","cooked":"

We experimentally find the correct angle for a bunch of different differences. We then curve fit a function to those angles and distances and use that function in the code. It has worked well for us.

This. Too complicated to model the flight characteristics directly just calibrate it at different distances and fit a curve.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T15:45:18.430Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":605,"readers_count":604,"score":166.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"jgwentworth96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59244,"username":"spearson23","name":"Steven Pearson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/779978/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23340,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344158,"name":"Dan_Karol","username":"Dan_Karol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan_karol/{size}/227378_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T15:49:43.558Z","cooked":"

No, We use slower speeds when we are closer. We have a function that increases RPM as we get further away. We stay at 18m/s until we get to 3m then we linearly ramp up to 30m/s until we get to the back of the stage.

We have a working implementation, this is the theory behind it that I wrote up.

Some notes: I forgot to write what hct means, but that is the height between the camera and the AprilTag.

The code for it is here.

We also just gather empirical data at various distances, then use this from wpilib to look up the values InterpolatingDoubleTreeMap (WPILib API 2024.3.2).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T16:35:47.183Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":465,"readers_count":464,"score":198.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"KJaget","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/interpolation/InterpolatingDoubleTreeMap.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"InterpolatingDoubleTreeMap (WPILib API 2024.3.2)","clicks":44}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344562,"name":"Asher Olgeirson","username":"Cynosure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cynosure/{size}/184875_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T20:35:36.385Z","cooked":"

We find all values experimentally, put them into Excel and run a polynomial regression on the values.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-26T20:35:36.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":424,"readers_count":423,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Asher Olgeirson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51179,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3344947,"name":"James Rechs","username":"Voxel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/voxel/{size}/233329_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T03:00:01.704Z","cooked":"

I’m also on 555 and can explain it more

The function itself looks something like this:

public double bestFit() {
    double x = getDistanceToSpeaker();

    return (78.3*Math.exp(-0.0177*x)) + 25.04;
  }

like spearson said, we put the robot a set distance away from the speaker and just tried different angles until they landed, then we plotted that on a graph (x being distance, y being the angle), repeat a bunch until you have a bunch of points.

We then found this line of fit and it seems to work pretty well.

The code we use for calculating distance and where this function above is can be found here, and if it helps explain it a bit more here is the shooter subsystem itself.

While I am very proud of the accuracy of this system, we have noticed that at more extreme angles it gets more inaccurate, this is most likely due to only taking data points from a straight heading (relative to the speaker), and not at an angle.

One possible solution we have is to have the function also take into account the value of tx (horizontal offset from apriltag), but there are several ways to accomplish the same goal. (also possible this is a speed issue, not an angle issue, we haven’t really had time to test it enough to be sure)

We had issues with the general trigonometry approach, and have found that this solution works really well even if you only have a few points.

Precurato","username":"Gavo9649","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gavo9649/{size}/181077_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T15:03:54.411Z","cooked":"

Hey there! I was looking at this thread and KJaget suggested using an InterpolatingDoubleTreeMap which basically works as a line of best fit without needing to find it yourself. We found a couple good distances with their angles needed to score, then you input those distances on robot startup (we’re doing it in our Tilt subsystem), and you can look up a shooter angle when you call the “get()” function when giving it the distance you’re at.

We have also only tested straight on and I’m worried about being offset left or right of the speaker as well as we haven’t tested that yet.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T15:03:54.411Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":82.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460194,"topic_slug":"dynamic-shooter-strategies","display_username":"Gavin Precurato","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64183,"username":"Voxel","name":"James Rechs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/voxel/{size}/233329_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53625,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3193"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-shooter-strategies/460194/14","custom_user_title":"3193","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3346209,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T14:15:49.902Z","cooked":"

We just put the robot straight on to the Speaker. Using vision we know the distance from robot to April tag. We made a table of distances and the correct shot angle at constant launcher RPMs, 3500 RPM in our case.
The table in Java looks like this…

private final double x_DistanceToSpeaker[] = { 49.0, 71.43, 91.6, 108.5, 129.5, 147.0, 172.0 };
private final double y_ArmAngle[] = { 56.0, 48.0, 42.0, 37.5, 34.0, 32.7, 31.0 };

We then use Apache Math library to create a Spline Interpolator for this table…
(Put implementation "org.apache.commons:commons-math3:3.6.1" in the dependencies section of your build.gradle

private final UnivariateInterpolator angleInterpolator = new SplineInterpolator();
private final UnivariateFunction angleFunction = angleInterpolator.interpolate(x_DistanceToSpeaker, y_ArmAngle);

This is all pre-calculated when the robot starts. We have it in the constructor of our Vision subsystem.

Now when we need the shot angle given a variable distance (this is a little bit of pseudo code as I cleaned out some very specific code for our robot so as not to confuse)…

public double getInterpolatedShooterAngle() {
   double distance;
   double shootAngle = 0.0;
   if (DriverStation.getAlliance().get() == Alliance.Blue) {
      distance = getFrontCameraDistanceToTag3D(VisionConstants.BLUE_SPEAKER_CENTER_APRILTAG);
   } else {
      distance = getFrontCameraDistanceToTag3D(VisionConstants.RED_SPEAKER_CENTER_APRILTAG);
   }
   double distanceInches = Units.metersToInches(distance);

   if (distanceInches >= MIN_DISTANCE_TO_SPEAKER && distanceInches <= MAX_DISTANCE_TO_SPEAKER)
   {
      shootAngle = angleFunction.value(distanceInches);
   } else {
      shootAngle = DEFAULT_SHOOT_ANGLE;
   }
    
   return shootAngle;
}

Yeah we heard about those InterpolatingDoubleTreeMaps and honestly the only reasoning I have for us using this system was that “we felt like it” and we “just wanted to”. I’m sure that InterpolatingDoubleTreeMaps work just as well if not slightly better.

Regarding shots that are offset to the left or right more, while it definitely was a problem for us, it was only at more extreme offsets for the speaker, we competed in both Allentown and Warren Hills without any special modification to account for it and our accuracy was fine.

I definitely think that there are some solutions that could be implemented to account for that offset (changing speed/angle based on gyro heading, etc)
